section.section: If at any time the Health Department considers that a committed person is eligible for conditional release, the Health Department may apply for the conditional release to the court that committed the person.

The Health Department shall send a copy of the application for conditional release:
to the committed person;
to counsel for the committed person; and
to the State's Attorney, by certified mail, return receipt requested.

text.section:
Within 30 days after receipt of the application from the Health Department, the court shall issue an order that is in accordance with § 3-114 of this title for:
continued commitment; or
conditional release under the conditions it imposes after giving consideration to the recommendations of specific conditions from the Health Department.

If the court orders a conditional release of the committed person under this section, the committed person, the State's Attorney, or the Health Department may apply for a revocation, change, or extension under § 3-122 of this title.

section.section: An appeal from a District Court order shall be on the record in circuit court.
An appeal from a circuit court order shall be by application for leave to appeal to the Court of Special Appeals.
